intro: Galium trachyspermum f. hispidum, commonly known as hairy bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems that are densely covered with fine, stiff hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a slightly hairy surface. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
